p: The concept of the carbon budget discursively translates a temperature limit into the ‘atmospheric disposal space’ for carbon emissions (Jakob and Hilaire 2015). The concept however enables a further conversion of the allowable amount of CO2 emissions into the time remaining to a climate deadline—the ‘due date’ for exhausting the remaining carbon budget at present levels of CO2 emissions (Asayama et al. 2019). The spatial scarcity of a finite carbon budget can be recalculated—through the modelling—into the time scarcity of a tight climate deadline.
